title: geth 1.9.8-stable gave me fatal error: out of memory when sync with ropsten testnet.
body:
Hi there,

geth.1.9.8-stable gave me fatal error: out of memory when sync with ropsten testnet.

#### System information
windows server2012 version
8G RAM
C:\>geth version
Geth
Version: 1.9.8-stable
Git Commit: d62e9b285777c036c108b89fac0c78f7855ba314
Git Commit Date: 20191126
Architecture: 386
Protocol Versions: [64 63]
Go Version: go1.13.4
Operating System: windows
GOPATH=
GOROOT=C:\go

#### Expected behaviour
geth can sync with ropsten testnet and do not crash with out of memory.

#### Actual behaviour

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
in order to update my geth in testnet, I updated Version: 1.9.7-stable to Version: 1.9.8-stable
and sync again.

use 1.9.7-stable to sync ropsten testnet, synced for a while and stop geth, update  1.9.7 to 1.9.8
and restart geth.


#### Backtrace
run below from cmd, and check get log.
````
[backtrace]
 C:\geth\1.9.8\geth.exe  --datadir=C:\geth\data.testnet --testnet --port 8080 --syncmode "fast" --cache=1024 --rpc --rpcport 8545 --cache.trie 1024 --rpcaddr "0.0.0.0" --rpcapi "eth,web3,net,shh,miner,rpc,txpool" --verbosity 4 
````
after restart geth the out of memory error happend.

The flag `cache.trie` is a _percentage_, normally set to `25`. You set it to `1024`. That means
```
		cache.TrieCleanLimit = ctx.GlobalInt(CacheFlag.Name) * ctx.GlobalInt(CacheTrieFlag.Name) / 100
```
That the `TrieCleanLimit` becomes `1024MB * 1024 / 100`, so about `10G`.
@holiman  remove --cache.trie 1024 paramter, restart geth, also the same [fatal error: out of memory].

hi @holiman  even set  --cache.trie 5 , restart geth, also the same [fatal error: out of memory].
the Trie memory size 1024 MB* 5 / 100 = 52MB, why it also happen?
